definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: He helped his sister out of the carriage.

sentences.chinese: 馬車停下來，他被抓住了。

sentences.english: The carriage used to carry the king was on display in the museum.
sentences.chinese: 那輛用來載送國王的馬車，在博物館中展覽。

sentences.english: One day as he was driving home from the market, he dropped his knife.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他駕馭着馬車從家去趕集，他掉了他的刀。

sentences.english: He alights first, and passes immediately into his own room.
sentences.chinese: 他首先下了馬車，立刻走到他自己的房間裏去。

sentences.english: He went to town by a sulky .
sentences.chinese: 他乘單座二輪馬車進城了。

sentences.english: The first white settlers traveled across America in wagons.
sentences.chinese: 第一批白人定居者橫跨美洲大陸時乘的是四輪馬車。

sentences.english: They entered the carriage once more, and the coachman mounted his box.
sentences.chinese: 他們又坐上馬車，車伕坐到自己的位子上。

sentences.english: The horse took fright and ran away with the carriage.
sentences.chinese: 馬受了驚，拖着馬車狂奔起來。

sentences.english: There are also horse-driven carriages, especially in Chinatown and other touristy places.
sentences.chinese: 除此以外還有馬車，特別是在唐人街和其他旅遊勝地。

sentences.english: Just permit the dime that she so shrinks in the carriage, allow her to so wail.
sentences.chinese: 只是任她那麼縮在馬車的一角，任她那麼哭着。

sentences.english: She would have preferred the humble cart.
sentences.chinese: 她似乎寧肯坐那輛簡陋寒酸的馬車。

sentences.english: Mrs. Bennet and Lydia are going in the carriage to Meryton.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽和麗迪雅乘着馬車到麥裏屯去了。

sentences.english: How do you know that it was the same fiacre ?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼知道這馬車是他坐的那輛呢？

sentences.english: She was a pathetic figure as she stepped out of the cab with the baby in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 她抱着孩子從馬車上下來，一付哀婉動人的樣子。

sentences.english: It was like owning your private carriage and having a coachman who wore a silk hat.
sentences.chinese: 就像你擁有了一輛私人馬車，就連車伕都戴着大禮帽。

definition: car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
